Fred then applied his management and interpersonal skills to a consulting position with a national consulting firm which provided healthcare and organizational development consulting services to Fortune 500 companies such as Motorola, Southwestern Bell, AT&T, and many others. In 1986, he branched out on his own and founded Roh Investment Consultants, an investment firm specializing in raising capital for start-up ventures as well as employee benefits consulting and financial services for employers and individuals.

In 1993, he co-founded and was president of a national physician networking organization which included membership of over 18,000 physicians in all 50 states which served over 25 million patients across the country. From 2006 to the present, Fred has been a Managing Member of a payroll management firm which provides services for over 100 employers with 2000 employees. Continuing his dedication to his faith and his community, Fred also serves as a Group Leadership Training Director for his church in Arizona.

Fred is on the Board of Directors for several local sports organizations and community high schools where his children attend and has served as a basketball coach for many years helping high school athletes further their education and prepare for college scholarships and athletic competition.
